message:
Merge branch 'projection' into projection-clipAngle

Conflicts:
	d3.v2.js
	d3.v2.min.js
	src/geo/path.js
	src/geo/projection.js
Rename p to projection for clarity.

Replace projection.ring with projection.polygon.

This is now forwards-compatible should desire complex clipping.

Separate out cutting and clipping.

Setting projection.clipAngle(null) enables antemeridian cutting (the
default). However, it would be nice to support cutting of different
antemeridian heights, so perhaps projection.cut(true | false) or
something else would be better, since clipAngle could apply to both.

Replace projection.ring with projection.polygon.

This allows correct clipping to take place when holes are involved. This
fixes an artefact that appears in a stereographic projection example,
which probably occurred due to misinterpreting a hole as an exterior.

Minor optimisations.

This makes use of the fact that we now have a fixed circle origin. Note
that the Cartesian centre of the circle can still change depending on
the angle. More optimisations to come!
Fix missing string coercion for d3.tween.

Merge pull request #826 from jasondavies/projection

Only attempt to resample if distance < δ.

Increase resampling min. distance threshold.

It seems reasonable to expect that the perpendicular distance will be
less than half the distance between two points, especially if they are
already close together.

Only attempt to resample if distance < δ.

This improves performance in the case where our input data is already of
a high enough resolution, even when subject to distortion. It’s unlikely
that the Douglas–Peucker estimate (perpendicular distance) will be
greater than δ if the two input points are already closer than δ. We
could probably even increase the threshold a little more e.g. 2 * δ
seems reasonable.

Adaptive using Douglas–Peucker estimate.

Use deviation from straight line rather than distance between points.
Bah, fix another bug. Need tests, stat!

path(null) should return null.

This frequently happens when a feature is fully clipped.
Merge branch 'projection' of https://github.com/jasondavies/d3 into projection

Merge pull request #823 from jasondavies/projection

Interpolate polygon cuts correctly, and resample.

Increase resampling recursion depth.

Otherwise Albers shows some graticule artefacts near the North Pole for
rotate([0, 0, 45]). It may be worth investigating what happens to k near
the poles, in case we need to override it.

Restore graticule precision.

This is not configurable for now, since resampling should do the rest.
The distortion of parallels is quite noticeable without this,
particularly nearer the poles (since parallels are not all great
circles), so we need *some* precision to begin with here.
Fix accuracy issue when interpolating near poles.

Adaptive resampling.

Can still be optimised further by caching trig. results.

Initial version of resampling.

This non-adaptively uses d3.geo.greatArc at the moment. This needs to be
rewritten to be adaptive, more efficient, and handle interpolating at
poles e.g. 〈-180°, -90°〉↦〈180°, -90°〉 should interpolate
longitudinally.

Fix bug at rotate([62, -174, 0]).

Includes a minor optimisation.

Better polygon cutting.

One more thing left to do: interpolate along the cut line when joining
endpoints. Ideally, the distance between interpolated points should be
less than 180°. This should probably also apply to points interpolated
at ±90° latitudes.
Merge branch 'projection' of https://github.com/jasondavies/d3 into projection
Merge branch 'projection' of https://github.com/jasondavies/d3 into projection
Add antemeridian cutting for all projections.
Allow d3.geo.path's context to be overridden.

Merge pull request #821 from jasondavies/projection

Add projection.{line,polygon} support to d3.geo.path.
Hide d3.geo.rotation to minimize API surface area.

Checkpoint integration of geo/projection plugin.

This is still a work in progress, but it's a start.
Fix #816 - getters for projection and pointRadius.

Improve performance by deleting code.

We can use the implicit array.toString() rather than join(",").
Revert previous commit; move urlencode to plugin.

Add d3.urlencode.

And d3.xhr now detects if the data has a type attribute; if so, this is used to
set the Content-Type header if one has not already been specified. In
conjunction with d3.urlencode, it is now easy to post encoded parameters.
Don't set a default Content-Type header.

More convenient d3.xhr interface.

Rather than setting the method and data, you can now call get or post.

Specify default Content-Type with data.

Also, headers should be case-insensitive.

Remove abort events.

Since the caller is the one aborting, it can handle its own notification.
Make d3.xhr more declarative and less stateful.

Rename xhr.content to xhr.response.

The name content is a bit ambiguous since the request can post content, too.

Merge branch 'xhr-accept' of https://github.com/jasondavies/d3 into xhr2

Conflicts:
	src/core/xhr.js

More flexible XHR framework.

This is backwards-compatible, yet adds numerous features to d3.xhr. You can now:

  * Use standard node-style callbacks (fixes #473).
  * Abort in-flight requests.
  * Listen for progress events.
  * Listen for load, error and abort events separately.
  * Make POST requests (or any other method), including data.
  * Set arbitrary request headers.
  * Have multiple listeners on requests.
Bump version number to appease Bower.
force layout: properly UNSET the .fixed bits: user may be using further bits and those should be kept intact.

export force.drag instance so user can access it by calling force.drag() with no arguments; the drag events have been namespaced as <event>.force, similar to the other force events: mouseover.force and mouseout.force.

Add "*/*" to Accept header.

This avoids a 406 error from servers that don't support a given mime
type.
Fix for JavaScript's broken Date API.
Fix a bug in preserving fixed state.
